result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If you wish to appear in person, please contact Judge VanDeHey's Judicial Assistant at (608) 723-7826.

Preliminary hearing on May 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Colin Richard Hardersen appeared by video, in custody from Grant County Jail.  Attorney Lisa A. Riniker in court for State of Wisconsin. Court explains charges, penalties, and right to counsel. State requests $1000 cash bond. Defendant heard on bond. Court heard and orders $200 cash bond with conditions not to possess or consume any intoxicants and to contact SPD today. Preliminary hearing set.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any intoxicants during the pendency of this case. 
Defendant shall go to the Public Defender's Office today.
